# The Instructions Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Functions in this group relate to the inspection and manipulation of individual instructions. <a href="#details">More...</a>

  type="&nbsp;"

## Description {#details}

Functions in this group relate to the inspection and manipulation of individual instructions.

In the C++ API, an instruction is modeled by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">llvm::Instruction</a>. This class has a large number of descendents. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">llvm::Instruction</a> is a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">llvm::Value</a> and in the C API, instructions are modeled by <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a>.

This group also contains sub-groups which operate on specific <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">llvm::Instruction</a> types, e.g. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">llvm::CallInst</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Functions

### LLVMDeleteInstruction() {#ga1df40856b5c6e9596662a1351aae55d9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMDeleteInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Delete an instruction.

The instruction specified is deleted. It must have previously been removed from its containing building block.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a99d640257f7689aa8095dccfb111e50c">llvm::Value::deleteValue()</a>
</SectionUser>

</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetFCmpPredicate() {#ga760b1ce7242d06e8487030821b65db03}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMRealPredicate LLVMGetFCmpPredicate (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Obtain the float predicate of an instruction.

This is only valid for instructions that correspond to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fcmpinst">llvm::FCmpInst</a>.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#aa7414ba9f658ff1287d22a4b8fe81bcb">llvm::FCmpInst::getPredicate()</a>
</SectionUser>

### LLVMGetFirstDbgRecord() {#ga6e90b343d4fcf1d5c02d8d206f9c2aa5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMDbgRecordRef LLVMGetFirstDbgRecord (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Obtain the first debug record attached to an instruction.

Use <a href="#gaa99f04cf33dd9e247331a69865e94b35">LLVMGetNextDbgRecord()</a> and <a href="#ga02b418f09d469e7a4ca88ba5a0b3db98">LLVMGetPreviousDbgRecord()</a> to traverse the sequence of DbgRecords.

Return the first DbgRecord attached to Inst or NULL if there are none.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a431be97c0e4d03f713d927197cdcfff0">llvm::Instruction::getDbgRecordRange()</a>
</SectionUser>

</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetNextInstruction() {#ga1b4c3bd197e86e8bffdda247ddf8ec5e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueRef LLVMGetNextInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Obtain the instruction that occurs after the one specified.

The next instruction will be from the same basic block.

If this is the last instruction in a basic block, NULL will be returned.

### LLVMInstructionClone() {#ga0dc7a6006eac9d6744c2b458c0603bf2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueRef LLVMInstructionClone (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Create a copy of &#39;this&#39; instruction that is identical in all ways except the following:

<ul>
<li>The instruction has no parent</li>
<li>The instruction has no name</li>
</ul>



<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a0a4d51e372293abe5e5f6dac133e80a6">llvm::Instruction::clone()</a>
</SectionUser>

### LLVMInstructionEraseFromParent() {#ga89bfe2f233c9e53a4e7bdd81a3fc19f9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMInstructionEraseFromParent (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Remove and delete an instruction.

The instruction specified is removed from its containing building block and then deleted.

### LLVMInstructionRemoveFromParent() {#ga91424099b9855974f57b59a80d43f1bc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMInstructionRemoveFromParent (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Remove an instruction.

The instruction specified is removed from its containing building block but is kept alive.

### LLVMIsATerminatorInst() {#ga311f6b62ff22317b8f99677f1e62732b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueRef LLVMIsATerminatorInst (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Inst)</>}>
Determine whether an instruction is a terminator.

This routine is named to be compatible with historical functions that did this by querying the underlying C++ type.
